title: Secondary – Cycle 2 – Progression of Learning - Drama (2010)
subject: Arts Education

document.title: Secondary – Cycle 2 – Progression of Learning - Drama (2010)

01A4B8346FD94A6CBB6C2F66FEB39A6A.description: Picks out elements that contributed to the development of the appreciation and that he/she could apply in a subsequent project (e.g. different sources of information used, recording methods)

133E89430D51453C83F685BB0620138F.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the appreciation process and to the strategies used (e.g. centering techniques for focusing on the work, strategies related to observation and perception for analyzing the work)

BDB6BD60F1C44AB38CF2C6BFBB63ED7C.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the appreciation process and especially to the strategies used (e.g.use of different methods to develop his/her perceptive acuity)

F436197A51704F8C950702A633DC6442.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed for each program

8E96E959448149E8A63F6F32D23BD5C3.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed in this program

C252723D817640878303AB9405137ABA.description: Justifies his/her point of view based on the content of the work, the meaning perceived and the selected appreciation criteria (e.g. problems of communication criticized in the work and demonstrated by characters who are insensitive to each other, as illustrated by their position in the performance space)

3E187E51E69A41308118CD82923AFBD6.description: Justifies his/her point of view basing his/her arguments on the connections between the different elements selected (e.g. the intensity of certain emotions supported by a sound environment and various movements on stage)

05C6A2A185FE4DD590158241E65C23AD.description: Expresses his/her preferences based on arguments related to his/her observations and the appreciation criteria selected

F1D085075A4142BBBB09F44D7B52F04A.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed for each program

20F7B34A257C4D7A87F03C8638781F4F.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed in this program

C7415E5EE51B49C99A0CEE5E80E83A48.description: Makes connections between the elements observed, the meaning perceived, and the symbolism of the work (e.g. references meaningful to the audience)

2479439056834B6B928EFD93013EE788.description: Makes connections between the elements observed, the meaning perceived and the expressive elements of the work (e.g. expression of emotion using the body and the voice)

D776D9C1DB76483DA7E36947C8006196.description: Makes connections between the elements observed and the meaning perceived (e.g. treatment of certain theatrical choices, of certain elements related to the character)

5945E08723394F138B5B42AEB3A2364E.description: Interprets the meaning of the work

E72080C248364D93863856CA93919645.description: Describes different aspects of using theatrical structures associated with the stage and multimedia (e.g. production procedures, performance space and multimedia, visual and sounds elements, theatrical techniques)

728941BD0BC94604BE6915E0382A4B8D.description: Describes different aspects of using theatrical structure (e.g. visual and sound elements, ensemble work, theatrical techniques)

EF43977E5A5F4A758A2705A38436A92A.description: Describes the function or use of certain props and elements of scenery

323A052928E64CBA9618FED4C7DE1D17.description: Describes the function or use of certain costumes

E0B10CC1B4F34D29BAFD8B7817C8C044.description: Picks out some aspects of stage directing (e.g. responses to sound and visual cues, conventions related to unified performance)

B3BF8D21E42E4E52828F6342171F9879.description: Picks out some theatrical choices (e.g. costumes, scenery, lighting, theatrical techniques, sound environments, performance space, theatrical space)

2E9D08F09D3346328E018C7C49D9AA2D.description: Describes how dramatic structure associated with the stage and multimedia is used (e.g. type of character, dramaturgical techniques, types of discourse, dramaturgical forms)

85123A47A43845A292EC6D4DF62DBF38.description: Describes how dramatic structure is used (e.g. type of character, types of discourse, dramaturgical form, aesthetic traditions)

D9745EA70EC645BEA647691564D2377C.description: Describes some passages that offer indications of time, space or action

922B7873A75343798BCE654AFC1776E4.description: Describes some key passages in the dramatic structure (e.g. components of the work: action, triggers, resolution)

A6FE542098AA4601AF74EF649A5FE375.description: Picks out some passages that include indications of time and space

5B538E32CAD946CB97FF4D9CAC87502C.description: Picks out some passages typical of the genre to which the work belongs

F5883850F9714C8F9200F8316080C898.description: Picks out some passages that mark the structure of the work (e.g. dramatic action, dramatic triggers )

B64BBC8D138148C485BD07D59857FF30.description: Picks out different types of discourse used in the work (e.g. aside, stage directions, dialogue)

8BCCA528F34D418FA73E63D70A24EF61.description: Describes aspects of performance associated with the stage and multimedia (e.g. building a character, body techniques and expression, vocal and expressive techniques, ensemble work)

ECD16B6D6178419A86C17D89041346E1.description: Describes different aspects of performance (e.g. building a character, body techniques and expression, vocal and expressive techniques, ensemble work, types of discourse)

FAC08B1853BF4A8DA39DE53318AE3836.description: Describes body and voice techniques in the performance (e.g. targeting the audience, exaggeration, stress, projection)

A6940D29C8294F06BB2F1FB7868F80CD.description: Describes elements of performance for the purpose of characterization (e.g. blocking, direction of gaze, vocal effects, emotion)

BF9C1C1EED36410A8C29383B71FFBCC8.description: Picks out body and voice in the performance of the work (e.g. energy, intonation, articulation, pronunciation)

A498B3B02EF6488DB5A992E417B2B856.description: Picks out elements of performance in the work for the purpose of characterization (e.g. attitude, gestures, gait, range, accent)

D8056469439F4ED88D32ADD0D504843B.description: Places in context elements of multimedia content that have symbolic significance in the work (sound editing, effects, projection of images, poetic texts)

20BC2D28187340638520F3666F389C1B.description: Places in context elements of content that have symbolic significance in the work (e.g. words, gestures, objects)

5B33E2139DA94CA690BC303C7AEA5CE7.description: Makes connections between elements of content identified and historical or sociocultural aspects represented in the work (e.g. particular gestures used, type of character, scenery, costumes, artistic period)

EE983F8F1F2C450E93BA8205B4CCDCD9.description: Picks out the component elements of a work as related to performance, playwriting and theatricality (e.g. development of content, trajectory of certain characters)

4B2AFA7E7E904080AD954967A3AE7456.description: Analyzes a dramatic work or excerpt

AF7FCCCCC90F44979924C7112AC61E98.description: Picks out the elements reinforcing the development of the creation that are applicable to subsequent projects, focusing on the relevance of choices, strategies used, observance of conventions and the performance context

859D67BE027C4961A2E57E0F596FA10F.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the performance process and to the strategies used (ability to observe pre-established conventions, strategies related to memorization and concentration)

067C76160DD74EBCB0EC29E6633762FA.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the performance process and especially to the strategies used (e.g. identification of distinctive traits of the character, memorization of dialogue)

7D1C75DF0FEF42BFB78E758D6F7DD053.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the terminology prescribed for each program

894FB498073D4EF2A5D826B9ECD4C9A1.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed in this program

BD8A8E564AFB49A1ACD1F6F2C599E87F.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, taking into account ensemble work, established conventions (of performance and theatrical structure) and the performance space, adjusting his/her interpretation during the performance of the work

10F034CFA1114A498D4302303C47D91D.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, taking into account ensemble work, established conventions (of performance and theatrical structure) and the performance space in his/her performance

F103B03A00314FEC96A465B48685533D.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, taking into account ensemble work, performance conventions and the performance space in his/her performance

F1B2417FD63B4BF9B33691B5CD5EE077.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, taking into account the performance space and conventions

8AFDAB4FD7E743708CDB99337647D561.description: Respects the conventions regarding unified performance

88917B16D6DA48DAA2AC33C0EFC883E9.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, using expressive multimedia resources that respect his/her communication intention and that of the author (e.g. sound, image, scenery choices, transition, rhythm, atmosphere)

6C0D3A6CFD584684A43FA6D6EF6FE58A.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, using expressive resources that respect his/her communication intention and that of the author (e.g. scenery choices, transition, rhythm, atmosphere)

7895ECE6523A40218B33FCAE7DF15A96.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, incorporating visual and sound elements (e.g. costumes, set design, lighting, sound environment)

A8219183F3014601B795C5036F5B6640.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, taking into account different expressive elements (e.g. content of the work, performance, dramatic structure)

35F44732646648AF8D41A6C3BC80A01B.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, memorizing the text and blocking

45D7465AE39A4E5882E98D335DA24413.description: Becomes familiar with the expressive nature of the work

C322B615AA884E3D92DF4E934F7168AB.description: Uses multimedia production techniques (e.g. round-table discussions, blocking, sound recording, image recording)

D6F764FF1945478D8FED7DCC609901EA.description: Makes choices adapted to the dramaturgical form of the work, according to the plan of playing areas and the relationship with the medium

01423A4B733A461A965599E6B156954C.description: Chooses makeup for the character to be played, in keeping with the staging context or the dramaturgical form being used

1FFE900B4249417BAB92E309349EFFAD.description: Chooses makeup for the character to be played, in keeping with the theatrical context

71FE0518B3144980BA3AF319467F0C6C.description: Chooses a costume appropriate to the historical and sociocultural characteristics of the character to be played

7B548CF34BE04848B90489C9C2501E73.description: Chooses a costume appropriate to the character to be played

A9ADBBEE06C3473AB65BF9DABE660E76.description: Makes choices concerning the use of stage area and performance space

303DC3EA96D6447A927CBB9FCCB4176D.description: Chooses costume accessories, elements of scenery, sound effects and simple lighting

9701CAE675174F3DBF70C96210466D58.description: Costumes, makeup, lighting, sound environment, stage area, performance space

DC991F80FE5C470E89BFD6A8656EA5D0.description: Tries out a characterization using body and voice appropriate for performance in front of a camera or microphone

E42A168E71FC4E30879359167BFF29F5.description: Tries out a characterization incorporating levels of language

5F58E32731F74C109B9CB0BC78C35ECC.description: Tries out a characterization using body and voice, especially diction and voice placement

C6F46D85508B4DC1BD1EE4A80A5B4CC4.description: Tries out a characterization using body and voice, especially targeting the audience

F7C21B02EFC04910B77ABB8CC38C992D.description: Tries out a characterization using body and vocal techniques (e.g. exaggeration, flexibility, breathing, rhythm)

06F12498F73B4AFAAD874A0AD256C218.description: Vocal techniques and expression / Vocal and expressive techniques

5B956AF630DB4B7DA06D4E3045CEA273.description: Tries out a characterization taking into account the dramaturgical form used

F29490E3F158401384AFFC6876050689.description: Tries out a characterization taking into account the dramaturgical form or the aesthetic tradition to which the work belongs

995980945D534CFD8A6E63095DF152B9.description: Tries out a characterization taking into account historical and sociocultural characteristics

DF881BC63B3E4F9CA2EE1A9F2DA64DD8.description: Tries out a characterization using his/her body, voice and especially emotions

067D323EF78A4D2FA10527966B758983.description: Tries out a characterization using the body (e.g. attitude, gestures, direction of gaze) and the voice (e.g. range, accent,silence)

34A60AA43F1844D890290EB64B4798A7.description: Picks out some narrative in the work passages that will affect its performance

EEFA729D0FEB417D89806C085CC2BFFB.description: Picks out and chooses elements in the work concerning the time, space and action that will affect its performance

D09F5114717C49B9A79E52525E1C8537.description: Picks out some indicators in the work that help to determine the aesthetic tradition to which it belongs

3ACD5C1CBFE846B0986D158B0A4E8652.description: Picks out some passages that affect the intentions of a character (e.g. dialogue, stage directions, monologue)

CE67A43CBBB3449080221BC716EE1F71.description: Picks out some historical and sociocultural characteristics of a character

AFE3FBD0D9EF41D68B6B52A8B4DAFE42.description: Picks out some clues that help to determine actions for performing the work

AF2962A9C3384FB9B1A6088A16D1ACB1.description: Picks out some stage directions, asides, indications of time and space in order to perform the work

C7D2E279697841BAA01E12A36FD09C0D.description: Picks out some elements related to a character for the purpose of playing the character (e.g. distinctive traits, intention, role in the action)

B3F70E69DA2F4ABDA052DDB7C38E7EC8.description: Emphasizing a characters types of discourse, conventions, aesthetic traditions

57DF9DB1F62C4C37A3C71C19191F33FE.description: Identifies the dramaturgical form of the work (e.g. audio play, video play, photo theatre)

5EAF9EB3F179493FA49D3A2AB8EA0D7C.description: Picks out passages that mark the structure of a multimedia work (e.g. sequence,ellipsis, rupture)

2E6BB4DCDC2349F291271EF1C440385E.description: Picks out some passages that offer clues for interpreting a character, or forproducing or adapting the work (e.g. identification of processes required forproduction, ideas for possible divisions of space for dramatization)

B5B2E697BA9D418393A71DAAFBA1CDB4.description: Identifies the dramaturgical form of the work (e.g. children’s or and youth theatre,street theatre, guerrilla theatre)

56805340E8C94655BF523176B09FED8F.description: Picks out some of the most significant passages that provide ways for interpretinga character or for staging, directing or adapting the work (e.g. establishingequivalencies for an adaptation or looking for staging ideas for a theatricalproduction)

F48C43F70BF84F579AA070EC6D68868D.description: Picks out the most significant passages in the dramatic structure that can be use for interpreting a character or directing the work (e.g. emotions felt by thecharacter, lighting to mark the structure)

8B019D648D7C4359B5425553D1AC3C8F.description: Picks out some passages that mark the dramatic structure of the work (structureof the work [e.g. action, triggers, ending])

D14B449C41DD48F0BFF0BAA6CB12E660.description: Picks out some passages that offer clues for interpreting a character or staging the work (e.g. identification of the role of thecharacter in the work, ideas for theorganization of space)

DCFF6DF3DE154E3AAC9F72B358321062.description: Identifies the genre of the work: comedy or drama

669BC90AE81A4E67AF81190EC5EB84BB.description: Picks out some passages that mark the dramatic structure of the work (e.g. dramatic action, dramatic triggers

323EDA3706CE4A079A4A08511692C909.description: Playwriting methods, dramatic structure, genres, dramaturgical forms

5454DC0C2BE84CE8826BF26364ACC7F2.description: Becomes familiar with the dramatic content of the work

D4A009DEA48140309FC6584FC361D18D.description: Picks out the elements reinforcing the development of the creation that are applicate to subsequent projects, focusing on the relevance of choices, strategies used, observance of conventions and the performance context

803365F02EFA47598EBBC4F7D8433CFC.description: Describes some aspects of his/her experience related to the creative dynamic, especially to the strategies used (e.g. use of the three phases of the creative dynamic, trial and error)

BE0C1CFEBCD94CCD93A51F5C234C3A10.description: Describes some aspects of his/her experience related to the creative dynamic, especially to the strategies used (e.g. strategies related to observation and listening)

CB1B635DEE7F4C9DA9C11C8D1828BAA1.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed for each program

06C981CFC4BF469EB1B3DD26127A94D7.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed in this program

9CD50E0E43E240A98453022FAA8AB47D.description: Links complete sequences in his/her creation, taking into account the audience reaction

13A2523D14D341908DB1C8B2D1CA87A7.description: Links complete sequences in his/her creation, taking into account choices related to ensemble work

65D14192797B4D18B24ED8F64D202C79.description: Makes complete sequences by adjusting elements of dramatic language chosen for the creative work and taking into account the external view

3E22C7E8E10F4E2DA9C9DD0853100181.description: Selects characters, dramatic situations and elements of dramatic language, specifying the most appropriate expressive choices for the desired type of multimedia environment (e.g. playwriting methods, type of discourse, performance for camera or microphone, visual and sound elements)

7A6BFEAB20D7488F85434B92A199BE4A.description: Links different sections of the creative work, specifying expressive choices (e.g. levels of language, monologues, choreography, visual and sound elements)

834322A682724D3E820870D759011C86.description: Links different sections of the creative work, taking into account selected elements of creative language (e.g. dramaturgical treatment, conventions on unified performance)

F0C31F451EB949F2A389BE2308D47A7A.description: Selects the most appropriate characters, dramatic situations and elements of dramatic language for his/her creative intention (e.g. resolution, use of theatrical technique)

6921B7C69D7C4BFA8DDABA84C256CBE5.description: Selects certain characters, dramatic situations and elements of dramatic language to refine the content of the creative work (e.g. types of discourse, character and building a character)

39D0E1C002444E529149D91553421E69.description: Tries out different ways of organizing the content of the creative work

FF90D810A9034FAE8BE3B08420674D2E.description: Selects a theatrical technique to enrich his/her presentation of an imagined dramatic situation

0AF21258E38C497EA6ACB1CC6955868B.description: Uses different processes of theatrical technique

9FAA37F0C1774A6AA652FFE5CE77ECF1.description: Tries out styles of theatre (e.g. performance in masks, body shadows, marionettes, clown performance, black theatre)

4F644D07F31D42C0B23C9ED6F16953A4.description: Selects appropriate approaches to handle a multimedia theatrical space (e.g. relationship with medium, divisions of playing areas)

A0E029C9A1C947F6951D4578AFABD98C.description: Selects a makeup style for the stage or screen, adapted to the different characters imagined

0078F1420C8840CAAF2260579A518F38.description: Selects a style of theatrical makeup adapted to the different characters imagined

59137B0F2DA142E8960575DC050DD313.description: Selects element of scenery, costumes, lighting and sound environments by imagining their use or function in different dramatic situations and according to their sociocultural and historic characteristics

4EBB4711EF1840F4917DD646BCA6F5BE.description: Selects costumes by imagining their use or function in different dramatic situations

51FF06CB098E4C3B94815DB3AC8A9921.description: Selects the organization of the theatrical space (e.g. stage/audience relationship) for different dramatic situations

90EEB67D5896472DA3AA7F1CC005CD45.description: Selects costume accessories, elements of scenery, sound effects and simple lighting for different dramatic situations

8651C99E41924F9BB200D3987CF9A8BB.description: Costumes, stage set, lighting, sound environment, makeup, performance space

03B07F53C31A4B97968D5C3B344019D0.description: Tries out dramatic situations using techniques of corporal and vocal expression, especially performance for camera or microphone

5512B708493D4B4596E064034D29566E.description: Tries out different levels of language based on appropriate dramatic situations

16CCAFDF0C694208B4D9444201024941.description: Tries out choreography choral movements based on appropriate dramatic situations

BBE15995EBC34375AB29C0B486F899A3.description: Tries out some dramatic situations using techniques of corporel expression (e.g. flexibility, exaggeration, opposition, relaxation, energy) and especially targeting the audience

4BDF705B844B4AD9ABFBFD04953F5A10.description: Outlines some dramatic situations focused on narration or advertising

0696FA25E10B4364BB125D373453064C.description: Outlines some dramatic situations using the following structural elements: sequence, ellipsis, rupture

9EE5E4A65D334C72B36BB71D87EA0F6A.description: Outlines some dramatic situations focused on types of discourse, especially monologues

DD630ED6EAAB453EB3A55BE01956559A.description: Playwriting methods, dramatic structure, types of discourse, conventions

C25F4D1FEB944E499F24D339FCC6EA6D.description: Describes a character using sociocultural and historical characteristics

249649D2378A4DFCADFF864A9D20066D.description: Describes a character using some sociocultural or historical characteristics

57E2D2B77CA14DAAAE39FD7B05124509.description: Describes a character using some sociocultural characteristics

8737A553198D4719ACE037CE87FF74A8.description: Outlines dramatic situations focused on a chosen dramaturgical form (audio drama, video drama, photo theatre)

5305F0D0ED8B4DF3AA32A63762A11CC7.description: Outlines dramatic situations focused on children’s and youth theatre, street theatre or guerrilla theatre

C7689A0BD088483D9B01CC7140E31465.description: Describes the following theatrical techniques: performance in masks (e.g. neutral masks, larval masks, commedia dell’arte masks), body shadows, marionettes, clown performance, black theatre

F81693D449564FAA9C695F401B5FBD93.description: Describes the following production techniques: round-table discussions, blocking, sound or image recording
